                        "content": "Jellyfish<br \/>\n            Jellyfish are not really fish. They are invertebrate animals. This means that unlike fish or people, they have no backbnoes. In fact, they have no bones at all.<br \/>\n            Jellyfish have stomachs and mouths, but no heads. They have nervous systems for sensing the world around them, but no brains.<br \/>\n            Some jellyfish can glow in darkness. The light is made by a chemical reaction inside the jellyfish. Scientists believe jellyfish glow for several reasons. For example, they may glow to scare away predators or to attract animals they like to eat.<br \/>\n            Most jellyfish live in salt water, apart from a few types that live in fresh water. Jellyfish are found in oceans and seas all over the world.                         "highlighted_content": "Jellyfish\n            Jellyfish are not really fish. They are invertebrate animals. This means that unlike fish or people, they have no backbnoes. In fact, they have no bones at all.\n            Jellyfish have stomachs and mouths, but no heads. They have nervous systems for sensing the world around them, but no brains.\n            Some jellyfish can glow in <em>darknes<\/em>s. The light is made by a chemical reaction inside the jellyfish. Scientists believe jellyfish glow for several reasons. For example, they may glow to scare away predators or to attract animals they like to eat.\n            Most jellyfish live in salt water, apart from a few types that live in fresh water. Jellyfish are found in oceans and seas all over the world. They live in warm, tropical seas and in icy waters near the North and South poles.\ntolong buatkan 5 pertanyaan essay beserta jawabannya menggunakan b.ing! tolong banget!",

                        "content": "How Lunar Eclipse happen?<br \/><br \/>\nAn eclipse of the Moons means the blocking of the Moon's light so that the Moon is dark (totally or partially) at the time we are supposed to be able to see it bright.<br \/>\nAn eclipse of the Moon occurs when the moon moves into the earth's shadow in space. It moves first into a region of partial darkness, called teh penumbra, then into a region of almost complete darkness, called teh umbra. Teh Moon may remain in eclipse for up to about two and half hours. During a lunar eclipse the Moon often takes on a faint glow. This is caused by the sunlight reaching it after having been bent by the earth's atmosphere.<br \/>\nTotally time last only up to about seven and a half minute<br \/><br \/>\ncari simple present tense!",

They are used to pull carts and ploughs, but they can be kept for their meat, milk, and hides. Only a few survive in the wild in Asia, but Buffalo are released to run free in the swamps of the northern territory of Australia. <br \/>\nBats have big ears, furry bodies and wings like leather. They are nocturnal mammals. This means they sleep in caves and atticks during the day and ly out to feed at night-time. Bats are the only mammals that can fly. They are very fast and acrobatic. When they chase after insects, they twist and turn in mid-air. Bats use sound to catch insects in the darkness. They send out high-pitched squeals they humans cannot hear. The echoes they bounce back tell the bats exactly where they will find their prey. Flying foxes, or fruit bats, are large bats that live in tropical Africa and Asia. They mainly eat fruit. What might be the best title for the song? 2. What is the song about? 3. What does this line \"You can take the future even if you fail\" mean? 4. Do you think the song teaches us to be optimistic or pessimistic?why do you think so?Give evidence to support you answer. 5. What might \"my destination\" mean? 6. What does this stanza mean?please rettel this stanza using your own words. I believe in angels Aku percaya adanya malaikat Something good in everything I see Ada kebaikan dalam segala yang kulihat I believe in angels Aku percaya adanya malaikat When I know the time is right for me Saat kutahu waktunya tepat untukku I'll cross the stream - I have a dream Kan kuarungi jeram - aku punya impian 7. Why do you think some words need to be repeated? 8. Which line do you like most?why? 9.Do you like the song?what makes you like the song? 10. What can you learn from the song? terjemahan soal: 1. Apa yang mungkin menjadi judul terbaik untuk lagu? 2. Apa lagu tentang? 3. Apa baris ini \"Anda dapat mengambil masa depan bahkan jika Anda gagal\" mean? 4. Apakah Anda pikir lagu mengajarkan kita untuk bersikap optimis atau pesimis? Mengapa Anda berpikir begitu? Berikan bukti untuk mendukung Anda menjawab. 5. Apa yang mungkin \"tujuan saya\" berarti? 6. Banded together into magical guilds they apply their skills in search of fame and fortune. Many such guilds dot the landscape of Fiore. But there is a certain guild in a certain town that soars high above the rest, one from which countless legends have been born... a guide that will no doubt continue to create legends well into the future. its name... is Fairy Tail.\"<br \/><br \/>\"Do fairies really have tails? do they even exixt... like them, this place as an eternal mystery... A never ending adventure!\"<br \/><br \/>\"its doesn't matter if you say the true origin of Magic is \"Darkness\", it doesn't matter if you say it's \"light\" either. Magic is alive. Its place changes over time and it grows along with us. Magic is anything you can think of. It can be felt in infinite ways... as light, as darkness, as red, or as blue and it is living freely, together along side fairy tail.\"<br \/><br \/>thanks^^",

Or i had thought nothing would happen, but i was wrong.<br \/>\n  That night, i was watching television with my family when i heard someone lit fireworks in my front yard. I peeped through my window glass but could see nothing. It was very dark outside.<br \/>\n   Then i thought it had to be my cousins who lit fireworks. Then i plopped down on my sofa again and tried to concentrate on the television since my mind raced with disappointment that no one gave something special on my birthday.                         "content": "BUAT 3 PERTANYAAN PILIHAN GANDA BERDASARKAN TEKS DIARY DIBAWAH INI, PAKE BAHASA INGGRIS YAA<br \/><br \/>\nTuesday, September 30th, 2008<br \/><br \/>\nIt was takbiran night. It was also my birthday, and nothing happened. Or I had thought nothing would happen, but I was wrong.<br \/><br \/>\nThat night, I was watching television with my family when I heard someone lit fireworks in my front yard. I peeped trough my window glass but could see nothing. It was very dark outside. Then I thought it had to be my cousins who lit the fireworks. Then I plopped down on my sofa again and tried to concentrate on the television since my mind raced with disappointment that no one gave something special on my birthday. I shrugged, it was almost the end of the day and I became pessimist. Five minutes later my mobile beeped. It was a text from my friend asking me to come out. Wondering what was going on, I grabbed my jacket and hurried to the front door. I was surprised to see her bring a bag full of firework and fire drills. Next I was surprised to see my other friend come out from the darkness. She brought a beautiful birthday cake on her hands. Oh my God! I shrieked. Then they gave the cake to me who was too stunned to say anything. I realized I was blushing furiously because my whole family was watching. Not to mention my neighbors too!<br \/><br \/>\nA plain day, or I thought it was before, turned out to be one of the greatest moment in my life. I didn\u2019t even know how to describe what I felt. Happy was the simplest word. <br \/>",

It was also my birthday, and nothing happened. Or I had thought nothing would happen, but I was wrong.\nThat night, I was watching television with my family when I heard someone lit fireworks in my front yard. I peeped trough my window glass but could see nothing. It was very dark outside. Then I thought it had to be my cousins who lit the fireworks. Then I plopped down on my sofa again and tried to concentrate on the television since my mind raced with disappointment that no one gave something special on my birthday. I shrugged, it was almost the end of the day and I became pessimist. Five minutes later my mobile beeped. It was a text from my friend asking me to come out. Wondering what was going on, I grabbed my jacket and hurried to the front door. I was surprised to see her bring a bag full of firework and fire drills. Next I was surprised to see my other friend come out from the <em>darknes<\/em>s. She brought a beautiful birthday cake on her hands. Oh my God! I shrieked. Then they gave the cake to me who was too stunned to say anything. I realized I was blushing furiously because my whole family was watching. Not to mention my neighbors too!\nA plain day, or I thought it was before, turned out to be one of the greatest moment in my life. I didn\u2019t even know how to describe what I felt.                         "content": "Underline  the indirect objects in the following paragraphs!<br \/><br \/>\n1.\tMorg was cross. She was more than cross, she was furious. She had been chosen to mind her little brother, again. Normally she quite liked him, as he stumbled after her on his short legs, babbling in a way that made her laugh, but today there was some-thing much more exciting happening. The men were preparing to go on a hunt. There hadn't been a hunt for months. First there was too much rain and then there was too much work with the harvest. But now the wheat was in and the grain was all stored in pits. The Druid was here, bringing blessings from the gods and medicines for the villagers. So the chief had decided that it was time. Outside the men were gathering and the Druid was chanting. Morg longed to be there.<br \/><br \/>\n2.\tBut Morg was not allowed to go. She wasn't even allowed to watch. Her brother was unwell. He had an evil spirit in his chest which was making him cough and cough. He had to stay warm, and to do that, he had to be in the hut. Therefore, while her mother was fetching water, Morg had to stay in the hut too. It was dark in the hut. A warm, rich, thick darkness, lit only by the glow from the fire which burnt in the middle of the room. Later, the fire would be built up so that flames would lick the round black cauldronand heat the stew for the evening meal, but for now turf had been laid on the logs. The fire would stay hot and alive, but would not need to be fed. Morg knew that fires were as ravenous as the wolves she heard howling in the woods at night.<br \/><br \/><br \/><br \/><br \/><br \/>\n3.\tMorg could smell the fire and the smell was as familiar to her as the smell of her mother. She could sniff and tell in a moment whether the family were burning ash branches or hazel, hawthorn or coppiced elm. To Morg, it was the smell of home. The glow from the fire lit the face of the boy who lay next to it asleep on the blanket. Morg swept the floor around him savagely. Any crumbs or discarded meat would make food for the rats, and her mother hated rats. Morg decided that today she hated her mother. She knew her mother was anxious about the cough because her sister had coughed in the same way before she had died. That didn't stop Morg from muttering a curse against the unkind-ness that kept her inside the hut. As she said it, she wished she could swallow the words back, but it was too late. She looked around worriedly. Maybe nobody had heard. She chanted a good will incantation, and crossed her fingers.<br \/><br \/>\n4.\tOutside, she heard a hunting horn, loud and sharp across the village. Morg sidled towards the doorway. She could see light through a gap in the planks, but that was not enough. She opened the door a crack. Maybe she could watch them from here? She might just be able to catch a glimpse of what was going on. But she couldn't see anything. The fence that kept in the pigs was blocking her view. She opened the door wider, and an icy blast of wind whipped it out of her hands. It banged crash against the side of the hut. Behind her the fire crackled into life and the baby opened his eyes. Morg did not notice. She fought for control of the door. She wedged it with a stone, so that it still looked closed at first glance. She slid out and across to the corner of the pig fence.<br \/><br \/><br \/><br \/>",

                        "highlighted_content": "Underline  the indirect objects in the following paragraphs!\n1.\tMorg was cross. She was more than cross, she was furious. She had been chosen to mind her little brother, again. Normally she quite liked him, as he stumbled after her on his short legs, babbling in a way that made her laugh, but today there was some-thing much more exciting happening. The men were preparing to go on a hunt. There hadn't been a hunt for months. First there was too much rain and then there was too much work with the harvest. But now the wheat was in and the grain was all stored in pits. The Druid was here, bringing blessings from the gods and medicines for the villagers. So the chief had decided that it was time. Outside the men were gathering and the Druid was chanting. Morg longed to be there.\n2.\tBut Morg was not allowed to go. She wasn't even allowed to watch. Her brother was unwell. He had an evil spirit in his chest which was making him cough and cough. He had to stay warm, and to do that, he had to be in the hut. Therefore, while her mother was fetching water, Morg had to stay in the hut too. It was dark in the hut. A warm, rich, thick <em>darknes<\/em>s, lit only by the glow from the fire which burnt in the middle of the room. Later, the fire would be built up so that flames would lick the round black cauldronand heat the stew for the evening meal, but for now turf had been laid on the logs. The fire would stay hot and alive, but would not need to be fed. Morg knew that fires were as ravenous as the wolves she heard howling in the woods at night.\n3.\tMorg could smell the fire and the smell was as familiar to her as the smell of her mother. She could sniff and tell in a moment whether the family were burning ash branches or hazel, hawthorn or coppiced elm. To Morg, it was the smell of home. The glow from the fire lit the face of the boy who lay next to it asleep on the blanket. Morg swept the floor around him savagely. Any crumbs or discarded meat would make food for the rats, and her mother hated rats. Morg decided that today she hated her mother. She knew her mother was anxious about the cough because her sister had coughed in the same way before she had died. That didn't stop Morg from muttering a curse against the unkind-ness that kept her inside the hut. As she said it, she wished she could swallow the words back, but it was too late. She looked around worriedly. Maybe nobody had heard. She chanted a good will incantation, and crossed her fingers.\n4.\tOutside, she heard a hunting horn, loud and sharp across the village. Morg sidled towards the doorway. She could see light through a gap in the planks, but that was not enough. She opened the door a crack. Maybe she could watch them from here? She might just be able to catch a glimpse of what was going on. But she couldn't see anything. The fence that kept in the pigs was blocking her view. She opened the door wider, and an icy blast of wind whipped it out of her hands. It banged crash against the side of the hut. Behind her the fire crackled into life and the baby opened his eyes. Morg did not notice. She fought for control of the door. She wedged it with a stone, so that it still looked closed at first glance. She slid out and across to the corner of the pig fence.",

                        "content": "artinya apa yang dibawah itu?<br \/><br \/>\nCome on!<br \/><br \/>\nCome on!<br \/><br \/>\nowareru youni isoi de iru<br \/>\nkawai ta mune ga kari tateru no sa<br \/>\nhito kiwa tsuyoku kagayaku hoshi wa<br \/>\nima mo tooku ni aru<br \/>\nushinatte yuku motome nagara<br \/>\nubawa rete yuku atae nagara<br \/>\ndare no tame de naku dare no mono de naku<br \/>\nore tachi no ima ga<br \/><br \/><br \/><br \/>\nAs if you are being chased, you are in a hurry<br \/>\nThis dry heart is screaming<br \/>\nThis stubbornly burning star<br \/>\nis still far away<br \/>\nI have been losing while I'm seeking<br \/>\nI have been robbed while I'm giving it<br \/>\nFor no one, no one's property<br \/>\nThis is our \"now\"<br \/><br \/>\n*omoi kasane yume o                         "content": "there lived two families, the Capulets and the Montagues.They engaged in a bitter feud. Among the Montagues was Romeo, a hot-blooded young man with an eye for the ladies. One day, Romeo attended the feast of the Capulets\u2019, a costume party where he expected to meethis love, Rosaline, a haughty beauty from a well-to-do family.Once there, however, Romeo\u2019s eyes felt upon Juliet, and he thought of Rosaline no more.<br \/>\nThe vision of Juliet had been invading his every thought. Unable to sleep, Romeo returned late that night to the Juliet\u2019s bedroom window. There, he was surprised to find Juliet on the balcony, professing her love for him and wishing that he were not a \u201cMontague\u201d, a name behind his own. \u201cWhat\u2019s in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet.\u201d Romeo was ready to deny his nameand professed his love. The two agreed to meet at nine o-clock the next morning to be married.<br \/>\nEarly the next morning, Romeo came to Friar Lawrence begging the friar to marry him to Juliet. The Friar performed theceremony, praying that the union might someday put an end to the feud between the two families. He advised Romeo kept the marriage asecretfor a time.<br \/>\nOn the way home, Romeo chanced upon hisfriend Mercutio arguing with Tybalt, a member of the Capulet clan. That qurreling last caused Merquito died.Romeowas reluctant no longer. He drew his sword and slew Tybalt died. Romeo realized he had made a terrible mistake.Then Friar Lawrence advised Romeo to travel to Mantua until things cool down. He promised to inform Juliet.<br \/>\non the other hand, Juliet\u2019s father had decided the time for her to marry with Paris. Juliet consulted Friar Lawrence and made a plot to take a sleeping potion for Juliet which would simulate death for three days. The plot proceeded according to the plan. Juliet was sleeping in death.<br \/>\nUnfortunately, The Friar\u2019s letter failed to reach Romeo. Under the cover of darkness, he broke into Juliet\u2019s tomb. Romeo kissed the lips of his Juliet one last time and drankthe poison. Meanwhile, the effects of the sleeping potion wear off.Juliet woke up calling for Romeo. She found her love next to her but was lying dead, with a cup of poison in his hand. She tried to kiss the poison from his lips, but failed. Then Juliet put out his dagger and plunged it into her breast. She died.<br \/>\nquestion:<br \/>\n1 whom did romeo love before he met juliet?<br \/>\n2 how did romeo know juliet?<br \/>\n3 what happened to romeo after she met julier? did he still remember his lover?<br \/>\n4 what happened to the two families?<br \/>\n5 what did juliet do after knowing that she would marry paris?<br \/>\n6 how was the ending of the story? could romeo and juliet live happily ever after?",

                        "content": "Teks (Romeo and Juliet)<br \/><br \/>\nRead the following text carefully !<br \/><br \/>\n   In the town of verona there lived two families, the Capulets and the Montageus. They engaged in a bitter feud . Among the Montageus was romeo , a hot-blooded young man with an eye for the ladies. One day, Romeo attended the feast of the Capultes', a costume party where he expected to meet his love, Rosaline, a haughty beauty from a well-to do family. Once there , homever, Romeo's eyes felt upon juliet , and he thought of Rosaline no more .<br \/><br \/>\n  The vision of juliet had been invading his every thought. Unable to sleep , Romeo returned late that night to the juliet's bedroom window. There , he was suprised to find juliet on the balcony, professing her love for him and wishing that he were not a 'Montague' , a name behind his own \"What's in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smeel as sweet. \" Romeo was ready to deny his name and professed his love . The two agreed at nine o'clock the next morning to be married .<br \/><br \/>\n  Early the next morning, Romeo came to Friar Lawrence begging the friar to marry him to juliet. The friar performed the ceremony , Praying that the union might someday put an end to the feud between the two families . He advised Romeo kept the marriage a secret for a time .<br \/><br \/>\n  On the way home . Romeo chanced upon his friend mercutio arguing with Tybalt , a member of the Capulet clan . That quarrelling last caused Mercutio died . Romeo was reluctant no longer. He drew his word and slew Tybalt died. Romeo realized he had made a terrible mistake. Then Friar Lawrence advised Romeo To travel to mantua until things cool down. He promised to inform juliet .<br \/><br \/>\n In the other hand , Juliet's father had decided the time for her to marry with Paris. Juliet consulted Friar Lawrence and made a plot to take a sleeping poison for juliet which would stimulate death for Three days. The plot proceeded according to the plan. Juliet was sleeping in death.<br \/><br \/>\n Unfortunately , the Fiar's letter failed to reach Romeo. Under the cover of darkness , he broke into Juliet's tomb. Romeo kissed the lips of his juliet one last time and drank the poison. Meanwhile, the effects of the sleeping poison wear off . Juliet woke up calling for Romeo. She found her love next to her but was lying dead , with a cup of poison in his hand . She tried to kiss the poison from his lips , but failed. Then juliet put out his dagger and plunged it into her breast . She died.<br \/><br \/>\n1. Replace the underlined words with the words from the text !<br \/><br \/>\n1. He is a very easily-excited person , he never looks sad<br \/><br \/>\nEx : yg digaris bawahi easily excited<br \/><br \/>\n2. I was so happy when he was declaring his love for me .<br \/><br \/>\nEx : yg digaris bawahi declaring<br \/><br \/>\n3. Tom is a very rich man .<br \/><br \/>\nEx : yg digaris bawahi rich <br \/><br \/>\n4. The drunken man killed the stranger man unconciously .<br \/><br \/>\nEx : yg digaris bawahi killed<br \/><br \/>\n5.                         "highlighted_content": "Teks (Romeo and Juliet)\nRead the following text carefully !\n   In the town of verona there lived two families, the Capulets and the Montageus. They engaged in a bitter feud . Among the Montageus was romeo , a hot-blooded young man with an eye for the ladies. One day, Romeo attended the feast of the Capultes', a costume party where he expected to meet his love, Rosaline, a haughty beauty from a well-to do family. Once there , homever, Romeo's eyes felt upon juliet , and he thought of Rosaline no more .\n  The vision of juliet had been invading his every thought. Unable to sleep , Romeo returned late that night to the juliet's bedroom window. There , he was suprised to find juliet on the balcony, professing her love for him and wishing that he were not a 'Montague' , a name behind his own \"What's in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smeel as sweet. \" Romeo was ready to deny his name and professed his love . The two agreed at nine o'clock the next morning to be married .\n  Early the next morning, Romeo came to Friar Lawrence begging the friar to marry him to juliet. The friar performed the ceremony , Praying that the union might someday put an end to the feud between the two families . He advised Romeo kept the marriage a secret for a time .\n  On the way home . Romeo chanced upon his friend mercutio arguing with Tybalt , a member of the Capulet clan . That quarrelling last caused Mercutio died . Romeo was reluctant no longer. He drew his word and slew Tybalt died. Romeo realized he had made a terrible mistake. Then Friar Lawrence advised Romeo To travel to mantua until things cool down. He promised to inform juliet .\n In the other hand , Juliet's father had decided the time for her to marry with Paris. Juliet consulted Friar Lawrence and made a plot to take a sleeping poison for juliet which would stimulate death for Three days. The plot proceeded according to the plan. Juliet was sleeping in death.\n Unfortunately , the Fiar's letter failed to reach Romeo. Under the cover of <em>darknes<\/em>s , he broke into Juliet's tomb. Romeo kissed the lips of his juliet one last time and drank the poison. Meanwhile, the effects of the sleeping poison wear off . Juliet woke up calling for Romeo. She found her love next to her but was lying dead , with a cup of poison in his hand . She tried to kiss the poison from his lips , but failed. The king and queen invited the Seven fairy to come and bless their daughter. In a magnificent event that was organized as a tribute to the fairy are, eachs fairy give thanks to the Princess.<br \/>\nFairy first said: \"You will be a princess so beautiful.\" Fairy second said: \"You will be a princess cheerful.\" Fairy third said, \"You will always get love.\" Fairy fourth said: \"You will be able to dance with a very graceful.\" \"Fairy fifth said:\" You will be able to sing with a very melodious. \"Fairy sixth said:\" You will always be happy. \"<br \/>\nArrives old fairy came into the middle of magnificent event.
